form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Moran (for himself and Ms. Cortez Masto) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand the advanced manufacturing production credit to include distribution transformers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Credit Incentives for Resilient Critical Utility Infrastructure and Transformers Act or the CIRCUIT Act.

section.header: Expansion of advanced manufacturing production credit to include distribution transformers

subsection.text: Section 45X of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (L)(ii), by striking and at the end,
in subparagraph (M), by striking the period at the end and inserting , and, and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
in the case of any distribution transformer, an amount equal to 10 percent of the costs incurred by the taxpayer with respect to production of such transformer.

clause.text: in clause (iv), by striking and at the end,
in clause (v), by striking the period at the end and inserting , and, and
by adding at the end the following new clause:

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: The term distribution transformer has the same meaning given such term under section 321(35) of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (42 U.S.C. 6291(35)).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to components produced and sold after the date which is 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
